intro: Polyosma odorans, commonly known as the fragrant mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host trees, while also performing photosynthesis. Its fragrant flowers attract insects, aiding in pollination. The plant is often found in coastal and rainforest regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
